jbt.execution.task.decorator
Class ExecutionLimit

java.lang.Object
  jbt.execution.core.ExecutionTask
      jbt.execution.task.decorator.ExecutionDecorator
          jbt.execution.task.decorator.ExecutionLimit
All Implemented Interfaces:
ITaskListener
public class ExecutionLimit
extends ExecutionDecorator

ExecutionLimit is the ExecutionTask that knows how to run a ModelLimit.

Author:
Ricardo Juan Palma Dur√°n

Field Detail

maxNumTimes

private int maxNumTimes
Maximum number of times that the child task can be executed.

numRunsSoFar

private int numRunsSoFar
Number of times that the child task has been run so far. Initially, its value is restored from the context.

child

private ExecutionTask child
The child of this decorator.

STATE_VARIABLE_NAME

protected java.lang.String STATE_VARIABLE_NAME
Name of the variable that is stored in the context and that represents the number of times that the decorator has been run so far.

Constructor Detail

ExecutionLimit

public ExecutionLimit(ModelTask modelTask,
                      BTExecutor executor,
                      ExecutionTask parent)
Creates an ExecutionLimit that knows how to run a ModelLimit.

Parameters:
modelTask - the ModelLimit to run.
executor - the BTExecutor that will manage this ExecutionLimit.
parent - the parent ExecutionTask of this task.
Method Detail

internalSpawn

protected void internalSpawn()
Spawns the child task if it has not been run more than the maximum allowed number of times. Otherwise, it requests to be inserted into the list of tickable nodes, since the child is not spawned.

Specified by:
internalSpawn in class ExecutionTask
See Also:
ExecutionTask.internalSpawn()

internalTerminate

protected void internalTerminate()
Terminates the child task.

Specified by:
internalTerminate in class ExecutionTask
See Also:
ExecutionTask.internalTerminate()

internalTick

protected ExecutionTask.Status internalTick()
Returns the status of the child task, or Status#FAILURE in case it could not be spawned.

Specified by:
internalTick in class ExecutionTask
Returns:
the status of the task after being ticked.
See Also:
ExecutionTask.internalTick()

restoreState

protected void restoreState(ITaskState state)
Restore from the ITaskState the number of times that the child task of this decorator has been run so far. It is read from the variable whose name is STATE_VARIABLE_NAME.

Specified by:
restoreState in class ExecutionTask
Parameters:
state - an ITaskState object containing past state information that should be retrieved, or null in case there is no past information to remember.
See Also:
ExecutionTask.restoreState(ITaskState)

statusChanged

public void statusChanged(TaskEvent e)
Just calls ExecutionTask.tick() to make this task evolve.

Specified by:
statusChanged in interface ITaskListener
Specified by:
statusChanged in class ExecutionTask
Parameters:
e - the TaskEvent with all the information about the change in the status of the task.
See Also:
ExecutionTask.statusChanged(jbt.execution.core.event.TaskEvent)

storeState

protected ITaskState storeState()
Returns an ITaskState witht a variable with name STATE_VARIABLE_NAME , and whose value is the number of times that the child task of this decorator has been run so far.

Specified by:
storeState in class ExecutionTask
Returns:
an ITaskState object with the persistent state information of the task, for future use. The returned ITaskState must be readable by restoreState().
See Also:
ExecutionTask.storeState()

storeTerminationState

protected ITaskState storeTerminationState()
Returns an ITaskState witht a variable with name STATE_VARIABLE_NAME , and whose value is the number of times that the child task of this decorator has been run so far.

Specified by:
storeTerminationState in class ExecutionTask
Returns:
an ITaskState object with the persistent state information of the task, for future use. The returned ITaskState must be readable by restoreState().
See Also:
ExecutionTask.storeTerminationState()
